title: Is it really true that some people in life have no chance to become rich and successful simply because of life circumstances? - Quora

response.answer_text: Upon receiving her Emmy award for Best actress in a drama series, Viola Davis said in her speech,“The only thing that separates women of color from anyone else is opportunity.” This is true for everyone, not just women of color. Every rich and ‘successful’ person attains their level of success because they have been given adequate opportunities. You can read more about that in Malcolm Gladwell’s book, Outliers: The Story of Success. The book explains the role of opportunity or ‘life circumstances’ in achieving success. It plays a bigger role than one might think. A person can not get rich by simply working hard, investing prudently, and making the right choices. The right opportunities must also be present to transform the hard working person to a successful person. That is the difference between children born into wealthy families and the poor people in a remote desert village. Don’t get me wrong, hard work and prudent investing are really important to success, however they mean nothing should there be a lack of opportunities. Take for example, Martin, a computer science major in a small community college in Kenya. Besides a demanding school schedule, he also has to work two jobs to support his aging parents and five siblings because he is the first person in the family to get college education. His parents were not well of. They were both farmers their own little farm that grew maize. As a result they couldn’t afford computers or even books for Martin to practice on. On the other hand is Luther, a computer science major at an elite university in London. His parents connections got him accepted into the university. His parents are both well-to-do, respected entrepreneurs so growing up he had all the support from his parents as he got his education. He got books and books and even his own personal computer to practice on. Supposing both Martin and Luther are hard working software developers but ten years down the line Luther is the CEO of his own company after developing high quality computer programs that he got to pitch to wealthy investors. And Martin is still struggling to hold down a job in a small time computer firm. Would you say that Luther simply worked harder than Martin? No, they were both brilliant minds and hard workers but Luther was dealt better cards; wealthy parents, elite university, access to books, connections with wealthy investors, and a PC.

No, it is not true. I can’t call myself rich but I’m at least earning. I have a long way to go. But I can surely tell, one day in my life I will be able to spend and not worry about my bank account. Every has an untapped potential. Here are few tips to come up in life 1) You need to surround yourself with kind of people which aligns to your goals. 2) Be friends with business owner/big shots and people who are double your age. 3) Network with people who are related to your work field. 4) Be diplomatic to people who can get you work in return for money or if they are influential because if they like your work, they are going to recommend you to many people. 5) Not being able to be rich or successful due to life circumstances is an excuse. 6) Forget about life-work balance. 7) And make sure you’re happy with the job you do.
